answers.answer: I sympathize with you, being so worried about your Dad. It sounds like there are several things possibly going on. Best advice is to work with specialists. Take good notes when the doctor is giving you/your Dad a report. Ask questions about what you don't understand. Then definitely get second opinions.

question: my dad is 55 and was diagnosed with an enlarged kidney and said to have a mass in it not sure what the mass is ct-scan shows mass but can not specify anything not clear enough.  He has high blood pressure, diabetes, obese, COPD he smoked 4 pks cig a day for over 20yrs was an over the road truck driver so of course didnt eat right..he quit smoking cold turkey about 6 yrs ago had alot of medical problems drop foot he went to dr because he was having pain in his private area...the dr ordered blood work a certain one came back should only be like .17 his was 1900 very very high...did ultrasound and it showed enlarged kidney with a mass.....but.....ct-scan didnt show anything clearly...concerned about doing the dye test concerned could cause more harm to his kidney...please help me to understand what is going on and what is going to happen to my father?
title: kidney
